moves.1. e4 c5: Not the least moves, to start with... This tournament was supposed, to honor the memory of Bobby Fischer. So the first move was thematic: all games started with 1. e4 c5... Bobby's Favourites, with both colours...
moves.2. Nf3 Nf6: I always like to explore... This is the Nimzowitsch Variation...
moves.3. e5: 3. Nc3 Nc6 4. Bc4 (d4, d5, exd5, Nxd5, etcetera) Nxe4...
moves.3... Nd5 4. Nc3 Nxc3 5. dxc3 d5: The Rubinstein counter-gambit... Always take d5 with black, if you can...
moves.10. Be3 e6 11. Rad1: After 10. Rd1, white has more problems. 11. Rfd1 is slightly favourable for white now...
moves.11... Qc7 12. Nh4: 12. Bd3, was the only way for white to hold an advantage... After 12. Bd3 0-0-0? 13. Bxf5...
moves.12... Bh7 13. f4 Bd6 14. f5 O-O-O: So far, Nimzowitsch hasn't paid off... Back to the books... So I needed a miracle... The threat Bxh2+, is probably strong enough for now...
moves.15. g3: 15. fxe6 Bxh2+ 16. Kh1 fxe6 17. Bxe6 might be better...
18. Bd3 g5 19. Qh5 is no better... After 18. Bf4 e5 19. Bc1 (Be3, Rf8) e4 white loses his edge completely...
moves.18... Bf5 19. g4 g5 20. Nh5: 20. Nd3 Bxd3 21. cxd3 (Bxd3, Ne7, and then what?) Ne5 22. Bb5 Rf8...
moves.20... Bg6 21. Nf6 Re7 22. a4: White loses control. The only option for equal play is 22. Bd3 Ne5 23. Bxg6 Nxg6 24.Ne4 Red7...
moves.22... Ne5 23. Ba2 a6 24. Rf2 Nf7: 24. ... Ka8 24. Rd2 Nc6 25. Qd1 (getting out of the battery, Qb5 is prevented by a6) solves white problems with h2... 24. ... Nd7? 25. Nxd7+, and black has nothing...
moves.30. Kg2: The losing move... 30. c4 b4 was the least...
moves.34... axb5 35. b3 Ra8 36. Bb1 Nd7 37. Ne: This loses. Nd5+ was bearable for white, or first bxc4, bxc4...
moves.41... e5 42. hxg5 hxg5 43. Bf2 Nf6 44. R: Practicaly forced, up until now... Now we have to outsmart the rook...
moves.47... Kd7 48. Rh7+ Ke6 49. bxc4: 49. Rh6 Kf7 closes in on the rook...
moves.49... bxc4 50. Rh6+ Kd7: 50. ... Kf7 51. Ke4 leads to forced continuations... Now after Ke4, Nxc3+...
moves.52... Kf7 53. Rc8 Rxb1 54. Rxc4 Nf6: I preferred this over Rc1, Bg3, Rxc2, Bxf4
moves.55. Rc7+: What else? Black has too many threats...
Now, that the dust is settled there is not much left for white...
moves.61... Nh2 62. Rc8+ Ke7 63. Bf2: 63. Bc5+ holds out much longer. Now it is over...
